column4: lol wine sucks, i opened a program like 20 minutes ago, it finally popped up now
wine does suck, when i try to open a .exe file with wine it just gives me a page long error report
why? its not going to do you any good
im assuming you want to make an archive of the folder, like a rar, tar, zip, bzip, gunzip or something
do u know what dpkg is for?
not really, it can, but its used for installing deb packages, and reconfiguring them and such
what are you trying to accomplish? are you trying to make a deb package?
that doesnt work: it says: dpkg: error processing *.deb (--install):
are you in the folder with all the deb files?
do i need to put a directory in?
have you looked at the man page?
i typed:  sudo dpkg -i /media/Imran's Hardddrive/Ubuntu Games/*.deb
why do you have so many debian packages to install? cant you use apt for them?
